matrix.matrixComp

Class MatrixComputationSparse

  • java.lang.Object
    • matrix.matrixComp.MatrixComputationSparse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MatrixComputation
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MatrixComputationSparseDistributed, MatrixComputationSparsePar

    public abstract class MatrixComputationSparse
extends java.lang.Object
implements MatrixComputation
    Provides the implementation for performing arithmetic operations between sparse matrices. All operations are performed in a single thread.

      • multiplyByTranspose

        public Matrix multiplyByTranspose(Matrix m)
        Description copied from interface: MatrixComputation
        Separates the special case of multiplying a Matrix by its transpose in order to avoid creating an extra Matrix in memory. The returned Matrix is created with the same type than the original.
        Specified by:

      • invert

        public Matrix invert(Matrix m)
        Description copied from interface: MatrixComputation
        Returns the inverse or pseudo-inverse of matrix m. The implementation is based on the Colt implementation, which uses the LU or QR method. The returned Matrix is created with the same type than the original.
        Specified by:
        invert in interface MatrixComputation
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to be inverted
        Returns:
        the inverse or pseudo-inverse of the matrix

      • invertByCholesky

        public Matrix invertByCholesky(Matrix m)
        Description copied from interface: MatrixComputation
        Returns the inverse computed by the Cholesky method for an arbitrary square Matrix. The implementation is based on the Colt implementation and the paper "Matrix Inversion Using Cholesky Decomposition". The returned Matrix is created with the same type than the original. Matrix m is first transformed into an Hermitian Matrix in order to the Cholesky to work. When it is applicable, the Cholesky decomposition is roughly twice as efficient as the LU decomposition for solving systems of linear equations. Consider Matrix D, the Hermitian A is computed as A = D*transpose(D). Then inverse(D) = transpose(D)*inverse(A)
        Specified by:
        invertByCholesky in interface MatrixComputation
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to be inverted
        Returns:
        the inverse
